sentences.en: 10,000 deaths a year from chronic lung disease are attributable to smoking.
sentences.cn: 吸烟导致每年有1万人死于慢性肺病。

sentences.en: an operation on her lung to remove a tumour
sentences.cn: 为她做肺部肿瘤切除手术

sentences.en: Before too long my lung abscess healed up.
sentences.cn: 没多久，我的肺脓肿就痊愈了。

sentences.en: Don't inhale dust into your lung.
He had a cancerous growth on his lung.
sentences.cn: 他的肺上长了个恶性肿瘤.

sentences.en: He was born with only one lung.
sentences.cn: 他生下来就只有一叶肺。

sentences.en: He was diagnosed with inoperable lung cancer.
sentences.cn: 他被诊断患了无法手术的肺癌。

sentences.en: He was rushed to hospital last week after suffering a collapsed lung.
sentences.cn: 上星期，他因出现肺萎陷而被火速送进医院。

sentences.en: Lung cancer deprived him of his life.
Lung cells die and are replaced about once a week.
sentences.cn: 肺细胞约每周新老更替一次。

sentences.en: Surgeons siphoned off fluid from his left lung.
sentences.cn: 外科医生抽出了他左肺中的积液。

sentences.en: The change in smoking is paralleled by a change in the incidence of lung cancer.
sentences.cn: 吸烟情况的变化与肺癌发病率的变化如影随形。

sentences.en: The test should identify which smokers are most prone to develop lung cancer.
sentences.cn: 这项检查应该可以确认哪些吸烟者更容易得肺癌。

sentences.en: There is an acknowledged risk of lung cancer from radon.
sentences.cn: 氡被认为有诱发肺癌的危险。
